data.message: There are rumours you're not coming to Liverpool.... Myself and lots of other people love to see the CocaCola truck. It's not Christmas without it. Don't listen to Richard Kemp from Liverpool City Council he does not speak for all of us. Isn't that right Sandra Jones :) please say the truck is still coming to Liverpool ❤

replies.message: Yeah it's in liverpool one in December. ...not sure of the exact date x
Really though, just... get a real life. Go outdoors for a bit, remind yourself what that's like.

So because she enjoys the Christmas tradition of seeing the coca cola truck once a year she needs to get a life?  I think its more like people like you that go on facebook to insult people who need to get a life

I do have a life Hutch Scott Hutchinson and Ben Delabane. You are the ones needing to get a life.... just making your negative comments. If you have nothing nice to say then don't say anything. Thanks Aakshi Vashist and Angie Horrigan for the info :) and Charlotte Banks I totally agree :)

You're right, that was needlessly negative. I apologise.

What I meant to say was that you are far more beautiful and valid a being than to need to invest so much of your happiness in the appearance of a piece of corporate machinery designed to suck away your precious and hard-earned resources. I encourage you to find your own happiness in something more personally rewarding and meaningful to yourself and those you love.
I personally hope they do come to Liverpool this year, i really want to take my little boy to see it for his first time 😊🎅🎅
"Christmas tradition of going g to see coca cola truck" 😂😂😂😂😂😂😂

Karen Taylor No, I am simply stating its rather worrying people are getting excited over commercials.  I can understand how it is seductive and hypnotic and that’s its intention. God forbid it goes and makes people go out and buy Coca-Cola. Capitalism is not positive for society it creates greed and poverty.  One of the reasons our MP’s are Corporate Servants and Public Servants and are shafting anyone not a CEO or very very rich.
Unfortunately, their target audience are susceptible to being told what to do, what to think, whatt to wear, what to eat and are not really encouraged to questions things.
